docTitle.titlePart:
Molekül- und Kristallstrukturen des Dibrom-
und Dijodmaleinsäurethioanhydrids

byline.affiliation: Institut für Kristallographie der Technischen Hochschule Aachen (BRD)

titlePage.note: Herrn Prof. Dr. H. Hintenberger zum 70. Geburtstag gewidmet
Crystal Structures of Dibrom- and Diiod Moleic Acid Thioanhydride

front.div:
The molecular and crystal structures of dibrom maleic acid thioanhydride and diiod maleic
acid thioanhydride have been determined by means of single-crystal X-ray intensities. The
crystal structures are isomorphous and have the space group P4i2i2 (enantiomorphous with
P4a2i2). The lattice constants are a — 7.643 A, c = 12.166 A (DBMTA) and a = 7.816 A,
c — 12.348 A (DIMTA). The five-membered rings of the molecules are planar with maximum
deviations of 0.003 A (DBMTA) and 0.005 A (DEMTA). Adjacent molecules are held together
by van-der-Waals-forces.
